subsection_content:
Liver fluke infection can be cured. Therefore, people with symptoms of liver fluke infection should see a doctor if they suspect they are infected to prevent complications.
Through examination, the doctor can prescribe the patient to take medication such as deworming drugs to eliminate liver flukes. Accordingly, depending on whether you are infected with large or small trematodes in the liver, your doctor may prescribe you to take deworming drugs such as Nitazoxanide, Triclabendazole, Albendazole, Praziquantel.
In some cases, medical treatment is ineffective, surgery can be performed when there is a liver abscess larger than 5cm in size.
